topic.title: HPE Helion OpenStack 2.0: Creating a Proxy, Account, and Container (PAC) Cluster

body.p: You must identify the control plane and node type/role when creating a cluster for Swift proxy, account, and container servers.

ul.li: In the data/control_plane.yml file, identity the control plane that the PAC serves are associated with.

Identity the node type/role used by the Swift PAC servers. In the following example, SWPAC-ROLE is mentioned as server-role.
Add an entry to the clusters item in the control-plane as follows:control-planes: - name: control-plane-1 control-plane-prefix: cp1
. . . clusters: . . . - name: swpac cluster-prefix: c2 server-role: SWPAC-ROLE member-count: 3 allocation-policy: strict service-components: - ntp-client - swift-ring-builder - swift-proxy - swift-account - swift-container - swift-client

li.p: You must change the member-count to match the number of servers, for example is you have 4 servers with a role of SWPAC-ROLE then the member-count should be 4.
